Author: breathypedantic
Text: well, i for one was triggered back into full swing eating disorder behaviour after having it... “managed” i’ll say, when first tried keto. so i’d say if “normalcy” is a goal, keto may be sort of difficult if not counterintuitive because it’s all numbers and counting and there’s the physical effect when you're getting it right.  so TW. also you will feel comparatively spacey for a bit. and keto requires meticulous tracking to be fat adapted. I eat like that the majority of the time because all the counting is incredibly soothing and it’s like a passionless way to be eating disordered in public. i don’t know. beware of keto my düde.

Author: JackFallsDown
Text: I haven't personally, but I did hear that the first two weeks on keto are typically rough, as in getting sick, bloated, and generally feeling shitty. My friends have been doing it for a while and lost a ton of weight. Let me know how it ends up working for you!
